我自己看完帖子看了下论文，论文结论是新冠的S蛋白中有四个insertions是SARS和其他冠状病毒中未发现过的，但是和HIV中的insertions基本一致。文章中表示“ This uncanny similarity of novel inserts in the 2019- nCoV spike protein to HIV-1 gp120 and Gag is unlikely to be fortuitous”暗示这四个insertion不是自然产生的。另外这四个inserts的PI值为10，因此认为促进了新冠对宿主的感染。
结合之前同济发的文章Single-cell RNA expression profiling of ACE2, the putative receptor of Wuhan 2019-nCov，里面提到唯一一例亚裔（男性）标本的ACE2表达水平远高于其它所有人（包括非洲裔和白种人），在平均值的五倍以上。这个事情的阴谋论怀疑可能这次真的撞上了。

HIV didn't even come up in the first 100. The 4th residue is missing like 6 amino acids. There are conserved regions in viruses. Their "gp120" match compares 6 amino acids out of 850 in the whole protein for example.
They found 4 sections that were in the new virus but not SARS. They then took these differences and ran them against all known viral proteins. They only looked at proteins with 100% matches, but if you look at the table they didn't match 100% for alignment. There's also tons of viruses that match these tiny sequences, they just noticed all 4 have HIV matches so they ignore the other matches and only looked at HIV.

第三病毒释放的方式可以是故意的，也可以是偶然的。既有可能是外部，也有可能是我们自己的机构失误导致的释放。
再完美的理论比不上事实，事实是SARS病毒偶然的切割了hiv的四段片段到自己身上的概率小到论文发表者不认为这是偶然生成的。

https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2020.01.30.927871v1.full.pdf
Conclusions
Our analysis of the spike glycoprotein of 2019-nCoV revealed several interesting findings: First, we identified 4 unique inserts in the 2019-nCoV spike glycoprotein that are not present in any other coronavirus reported till date. To our surprise, all the 4 inserts in the 2019-nCoV mapped to short segments of amino acids in the HIV-1 gp120 and Gag among all annotated virus proteins in the NCBI database. This uncanny similarity of novel inserts in the 2019- nCoV spike protein to HIV-1 gp120 and Gag is unlikely to be fortuitous. Further, 3D modelling suggests that atleast 3 of the unique inserts which are non-contiguous in the primary protein sequence of the 2019-nCoV spike glycoprotein converge to constitute the key components of the receptor binding site. Of note, all the 4 inserts have pI values of around 10 that may facilitate virus-host interactions. Taken together, our findings suggest unconventional evolution of 2019-nCoV that warrants further investigation. Our work highlights novel evolutionary aspects of the 2019-nCoV and has implications on the pathogenesis and diagnosis of this virus.
